page.title: 17Ecology cont.
page.content: rats, stoats,weasels, hedgehogs, pheasants and all the common small birds. Woodlands are mainly conifers and support most of the above life plus pigeons, magpies, jays, warblers, thrushes etc. while heron fish in the pond and beck. The open ground supports partridge, plover, skylarks, hawk, hare mice etc. Summer visitors include swallows, swifts & martins while winter brings fieldfare, redwing & pigeon. On average 24 inches of rain falls each year. It is usually cold enough in January or February to freeze the pond to allow skating for a few days and in the summer hot enough to tan the inhabitants. Gale force winds are sometimes experienced mainly in March and November.
